getTags.responseNotes: Lists all tags in currently authenticated project

patchTag.responseNotes: Modifies (currently only renames) an existing tag in the currently authenticated project

tag.description: Name of a single asset tag.

exportAll.responseNotes:
Export all translations from your project to a multi-locale language pack.

Note that not all formats support multiple locales in the same file. See /export/archive for exporting separate files, and /export/locale for exporting one language at a time.
exportAll.summary: Export your whole project to a multi-locale language pack

ext.description: Target file type specified as a file extension

filter.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter subset of assets.

index.description: Override default lookup key in language pack. Leave blank for auto.

fallback.description: Fallback locale for untranslated assets, specified as short code. e.g. `en` or `en_GB`

exportArchive.responseNotes:
Export all translations from your project to a zip archive of language packs.

If you're exporting to a file format that supports multiple locales within the same file, you can use the /export/all method
exportArchive.summary: Export all locales to a zip archive

format.description: Specific format, applicable to some file types only

filter.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter subset of assets.

index.description: Override default lookup key in language pack. Leave blank for auto.

fallback.description: Fallback locale for untranslated assets, specified as short code. e.g. `en` or `en_GB`

ext.description: Target file type specified as a file extension

exportLocale.responseNotes:
Export translations from your project to a locale-specific language pack.

Various export file types are supported with format variations for some types. See the full list of supported export formats.
exportLocale.summary: Export a single locale to a language pack.

format.description: Specific format, applicable to some file types only

filter.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter subset of assets.

index.description: Override default lookup key in language pack. Leave blank for auto.

fallback.description: Fallback locale for untranslated assets, specified as short code. e.g. `en` or `en_GB`

locale.description: Locale to export, specified as short code. e.g. `en` or `en_GB`

ext.description: Target file type specified as a file extension

exportTemplate.responseNotes:
Export only the source keys from your project to a language pack.

This is different to exporting just your source language translations, because it only exports the left hand side of each mapping.

See the full list of supported export formats.
exportTemplate.summary: Export a template containing only source keys

format.description: Specific format, applicable to some file types only

filter.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter subset of assets.

index.description: Override default lookup key in language pack. Leave blank for auto.

fallback.description: Fallback locale for untranslated assets, specified as short code. e.g. `en` or `en_GB`

ext.description: Target file type specified as a file extension

import.responseNotes:
The import API loads translations from various language pack formats into the currently authenticated project.

Take note of how the index and locale parameters are used to describe how your file will be imported. By leaving these fields empty Loco will try to guess your intentions, but it's advisable to specify all parameters if in any doubt. See examples.

ext.description: Import file type specified as a file extension

src.description: Raw source of file being imported

index.description: Specify whether file indexes translations by asset ID or source texts

locale.description: Specify target locale if importing translations

authVerify.responseNotes:
Loco API keys authenticate your user account for accessing a specific project.
This endpoint verifies an API key and returns the authenticated user, account and project.

getAssets.summary: List all translatable assets in your project

filter.description: Comma-separated list of tags to filter subset of assets.

createAsset.responseNotes:
Adds a new asset to the currently authenticated project.

If the asset is created successfully the response will be 201 (created).

If you specify the asset ID and it clashes with an existing asset the response will be 409 (conflict).

If another asset exists with the same name and you haven't specified the ID, a new asset will be created with a unique id.

name.description: Source text or just a name describing what the asset is

id.description: Optional machine friendly ID if you want something specific

type.description: Media type, defaults to plain old text

getAsset.responseNotes: Gets a single asset in currently authenticated project

patchAsset.responseNotes:
Modifies the properties of an asset in the currently authenticated project.

The full, modified asset object is returned.

type.description: Broad content type, defaults to plain text

deleteAsset.responseNotes:
Deletes an asset from the currently authenticated project.

Warning: This will permanently delete all translations made of this asset across all locales

getAssetPlurals.responseNotes:
Lists all assets that are a plural form of the current asset.

This list does not include the singular form itself.
getAssetPlurals.summary: Get plural forms of an asset

createPlural.responseNotes:
Creates a translatable asset that's a plural form of an existing asset.

The singular form asset specified as {id} must already exist, but the plural form will created as a new asset.

You can bind an existing asset as the new plural by specifying {pid}. In this case if {name} differs the asset will be renamed.
createPlural.summary: Add a new plural form of an existing asset

name.description: Source text for the plural form or just a name describing it

pid.description: Optional machine friendly ID if you want something specific, or converting an existing asset to a plural

unlinkPlural.responseNotes:
Reverts an asset from being a plural form to being a singular asset on its own.

This action does not delete any assets.
unlinkPlural.summary: Unlinks a plural form of an existing asset

tagAsset.responseNotes: Tags an asset with a new or existing term. If the tag doesn't exist it will be created.

name.description: Name of new or existing tag

untagAsset.responseNotes: Removes a single tag from the given asset.

tag.description: Term to remove from asset's tags

getLocales.responseNotes: Lists all locales in currently authenticated project. Your native/source language will always be the first in the list
getLocales.summary: List all locales in your project

createLocale.responseNotes:
Adds a new locale to the currently authenticated project.

If the locale is created successfully the response will be 201 (created).

If the locale already exists the response will be 409 (conflict).

code.description: Short code of locale to create, e.g. 'fr' or 'fr_FR'

getLocale.responseNotes: Gets a single locale in currently authenticated project

locale.description: Short code of project locale, e.g. `fr` or `fr_CH`

patchLocale.responseNotes:
Modifies the properties of a locale in the currently authenticated project.

The full, modified locale object is returned.

locale.description: Short code of project locale, e.g. `fr` or `fr_CH`

deleteLocale.responseNotes:
Delete a locale from currently authenticated project.

Warning: This will permanently delete any translations made in the specified locale across your project

Note that you cannot delete your native/source locale.

locale.description: Short code of project locale, e.g. `fr` or `fr_CH`

getTranslations.responseNotes:
Gets all translations of an asset across the currently authenticated project's locales.

Locales not yet translated are included, but their translated field will be set to false.
getTranslations.summary: Get all translations of an asset

getTranslation.responseNotes:
Gets a single translation in currently authenticated project.

Translations implicitly exist as long as the asset and locale are in your project.

Translations marked as complete have the translated field set to true.

locale.description: Short code of project locale, e.g. `fr` or `fr_CH`

translate.responseNotes:
Translates a single asset in a single locale in the currently authenticated project.

If the asset is already translated, a new revision will be added and the revision field incremented.

If the asset is untranslated the locale must have already been added to the project.

Binary file uploads are not yet supported, but will be soon.
translate.summary: Add a new translation in a given locale

translation.description: Raw value of new translation. Leaving empty puts a blank translation.

locale.description: Short code of project locale, e.g. `fr` or `fr_CH`

untranslate.responseNotes:
Deletes a single translation of an asset in currently authenticated project.

Warning: Untranslating is not the same as setting an empty translation. This operation clears the asset's translation history and user comments for the given locale.
untranslate.summary: Untranslate an asset in a single locale

locale.description: Short code of project locale, e.g. `fr` or `fr_CH`

errorResponses.phrase: Asset not translated in this locale

flagTranslation.responseNotes:
Flag a single translation as being incomplete or in error for the given locale.

Flagged translations reduce your project completeness.

locale.description: Short code of project locale, e.g. `fr` or `fr_CH`

unflagTranslation.responseNotes:
Removes current flag from a translation marked as incomplete or in error.

It's not necessary to specify which flag to remove, because there can be only one.

locale.description: Short code of project locale, e.g. `fr` or `fr_CH`

ping.responseNotes: Checks the API is up and returns the API version number

convert.responseNotes:
Use this API to convert between language pack file formats without a Loco account.
Precise options depend on the file formats you're converting between. See some examples.
convert.summary: Convert a language pack to another file format

src.description: Raw source of file being converted

ext.description: Target file format being exported, specified as a file extension

name.description: Domain/namespace, applicable to some file formats

format.description: Specific target format, required for some file types

locale.description: Locale of target language pack, required in most cases

native.description: Optional source locale, not required in many cases

index.description: Override default lookup key in exported file. Leave blank for auto.

errorResponses.phrase: No messages could be extracted from source

type.description: Broad content type, defaults to plain text

translated.description: Number of locales asset is translated into

untranslated.description: Number of locales left to translate

incomplete.description: Number of translations that are flagged as incomplete

tags.description: List of terms asset is tagged with

equation.description: Equation for calculating offset in forms. The formula takes a multiplier (n) to yield a plural form offset. ( 0 <= offset < length ).

native.description: Whether the source locale of project

equation.description: Equation for calculating offset in forms. The formula takes a multiplier (n) to yield a plural form offset. ( 0 <= offset < length ).

type.description: Broad content type, defaults to plain text

translated.description: Number of locales asset is translated into

untranslated.description: Number of locales left to translate

incomplete.description: Number of translations that are flagged as incomplete

tags.description: List of terms asset is tagged with

native.description: Whether the source locale of project

equation.description: Equation for calculating offset in forms. The formula takes a multiplier (n) to yield a plural form offset. ( 0 <= offset < length ).

type.description: Broad content type, defaults to plain text
Specific media type, e.g. text/plain, image/jpeg

translated.description: Whether plural translation exists, even if marked intentionally blank

flagged.description: Whether translation is incomplete due to an issue requiring attention

revision.description: Number of edits made, zero if not translated

modified.description: Time last modified in UTC, null if not translated

type.description: Specific media type, e.g. text/plain, image/jpeg

translated.description: Whether this translation exists, even if marked intentionally blank

flagged.description: Whether translation is incomplete due to an issue requiring attention

revision.description: Number of edits made, zero if not translated

modified.description: Time last modified in UTC, null if translation doesn't exist

native.description: Whether the source locale of project

equation.description: Equation for calculating offset in forms. The formula takes a multiplier (n) to yield a plural form offset. ( 0 <= offset < length ).

type.description: Specific media type, e.g. text/plain, image/jpeg

translated.description: Whether plural translation exists, even if marked intentionally blank

flagged.description: Whether translation is incomplete due to an issue requiring attention

revision.description: Number of edits made, zero if not translated

modified.description: Time last modified in UTC, null if not translated
